sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
A precept for the baptisme of infants out of the New Testament. Where the matter is first proved from three severall scriptures, that there is such a word of command. Secondly it is vindicated, as from the exceptions of the separation, so in special from the cavils of Mr. Robert Everard in a late treatise of his intituled Baby-Baptisme routed. / By Nathaniel Stephens minister of the Gospel and Fennie-Drayton in Leicester-Shire. Stephens, Nathaniel, 1606?-1678.
[12], 66 p.
Printed by T.R. and E.M. for Edmund Paxton, Nathanaell Webb and William Grantham; and are to be sold in Pauls Chaine neer Doctors Commons, and at the Greyhound in Pauls Church-yard, London : 1651.
The tract by Robert Everard is untraced. Annotation on Thomason copy: "Feb: 10.". Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
=======
A precept for the baptisme of infants out of the New Testament. Where the matter is first proved from three severall scriptures, that there is such a word of command. Secondly it is vindicated, as from the exceptions of the separation, so in special from the cavils of Mr. Robert Everard in a late treatise of his intituled Baby-Baptisme routed. / By Nathaniel Stephens minister of the Gospel and Fennie-Drayton in Leicester-Shire. Stephens, Nathaniel, 1606?-1678.
[12], 66 p.
Printed by T.R. and E.M. for Edmund Paxton, Nathanaell Webb and William Grantham; and are to be sold in Pauls Chaine neer Doctors Commons, and at the Greyhound in Pauls Church-yard, London : 1651.
The tract by Robert Everard is untraced. Annotation on Thomason copy: "Feb: 10.". Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
Edmund Paxton
Nathanaell Webb
William Grantham;
E.M.
T.R.
Pauls Chaine neer Doctors Commons
the Greyhound in Pauls Church-yard
